comment: Great Calc 1 professor. Extremely helpful in answering questions about difficult questions. Will stay long after class has ended to answer student questions.

Great professor for Calc 1. Homework is not mandatory but the test come from the lectures and homework. If you skip, its hard to get that material he went over because he doesn't post on D2L. Very easy to talk to and helpful if you just ask. Wish he taught Calc 2.

Trebits is a good professor. Take notes because some problems in class will be on the test and do your homework.   Has 4 tests then a final, drops one of your lowest test grades, an you have a A or B going into the final, you don't have to take it. Grades on a curve. I made a 64 on one test and ended up getting an A for the test. Good guy
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: He goes on random tangents and then crams a bunch of material in at the last minute frequently. He has a binder of his transcribed version of the textbook that he teaches you by. He drops your lowest test grade, if you make an A before the final, you can exempt out of it. His finals are cumulative.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He basically transcribed the textbook and teaches you based off of what he wrote down in a binder. He drops one test and grades on his own system. So if the class fails, he doesn't call it a curve but essentially the class gets graded on a different scale. Highest grade divided by 2, (past fail rate) and adjusts accordingly.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He never stays on topic, I learned more about his life rather than actual math & his tests were IMPOSSIBLE. AVOID THIS MAN
If you go to class, take notes, and do the minimal homework, you'll get an A.

Amazing teacher, Gets to the point but doesn't overload you with work. Follow the rule and you will succeed. No homework required but the question on the test are from the homework. He is snarky but he does it to keep your attention. The online material is not used. Every example is step-by-step he doesn't pull you should remember this from HS.

While attendance is not mandatory, he makes announcements such as homework, test dates, and class cancellations solely in class; never online. His tests are based mostly off of homework, which comes from the textbook. He doesn't check homework. He doesn't have a typical grading system. He gets off track A LOT.

Much better at teaching PreCalc than Calc, I had him for both. Lots of time wasted telling stories that he is always retelling. I stopped coming to class and learned everything through the book, because that is where he gets his lectures, and online. Grade is from 4 tests and final: curves tests based on the highest grade. Let me make up 2 tests.

Much better at teaching PreCalc than Calc, I had him for both. Lots time wasted telling stores that he is always retelling. I stopped coming to class and learned everything through the book, because that is where he gets his lectures, and online. Grade was from 4 tests and a final: curves tests based on the highest grade. Let me make up 2 tests.

Spends most of class telling storiesbad jokes. You'll hear repeatedly bc he forgets he told them. Don't expect to be taught any math. You'll have to teach yourself.  Grade came from 4 tests and a final. He scales & drops the lowest test but avg's still sucked.  Avoid unless your options are him or Shumard. At least he doesn't yell at everyone.

Curves every test depending on what the highest grade was which helps out some, but test and what he tells you to study is nothing alike.  All he does is talk and does the examples straight from the beginning of each section. Has very few office hours, would not take him if i was you.

He may get off topic, but that is what kept my attention through class. I really liked the way he did things. He doesn't require attendance, except for test days. He gives you a list of all homework problems for the semester. His tests are a perfect level of difficulty and he balances out the grades based on what the highest grade in the class was.

The homework is impossible, due to the fact he goes over nothing in class. He gets off topic, and then doesn't have enough time to go over the important stuff. His tests are nothing like the homework, and good luck with office hours
Great Professor, very interested in the success of his students. Teaches all of the material at a slow but agreeable pace. Tells stories for like 15 minutes at a time every now and then.

A glowing recommendation for Prof. Trebits. I had the pleasure of taking Precal with him and I have to say he is a great professor. He is pretty helpful to those who WANT to learn. He is also a Physics guy, so he relates math to real world things, which is good for us SPSU folk. If you go to class everyday and study, you will for sure make a easy A

Goes off topic about stuff that is already off topic to begin with. Lectures are writing out examples on the board that are straight from the book. Class average on tests was horrible, as no one showed up to class(attendance not required) & his lectures are more like story time. Curves are great, the second test a 70 was an A and a 40 was passing.

He doesn't much care about the theory that goes behind the maths he is teaching, and he keeps everything moderately simple. Not a class went by where he didn't share a story, a bad joke, or a interesting fact. His tests were very easy since he gives us a very similar practice exam, and questions are based on homework (which is due once a week).

Overall a great professor, there were homework assignments every week from the textbook. Every class he would do one or two examples on the board, and tell stories for the rest of the class. Before every test he gives a practice test which  were usually very close to the real test. I would highly recommend trebits.

I wouldn't recommend this teacher... He was hard 90% of the time. He would stop teaching almost everyday half way through class to talk about anything, that was good, kept your mind off math for a bit. But in all i wouldn't recommend this teacher..

Dr. Trebits is a great teacher. He is funny, but often gets off topic... and by often, I mean every class. He does get all the material covered though. The homework he assigns is optional, but it definitely helps. He gave out sample tests that helped too. He was always more than happy to answer any extra questions.

Good professor. Doesn't go much into theory but jumps straight to how to solve a problem, which I like. Likes to tell cool stories. Hates it when you're late, but is quite chill. Take him if you don't want you regularly attend class. Gives sample tests which really helped when taking the real thing.
Professor Trebits is a great professor. the best thing is that he is not a mathmatician. He relates to his students and is willing to help any way he can. You have to ask for the help.
I expected Calculus to be a good bit more difficult, but I actually found the course easy. Maybe it's just me or that he teaches well. Assigns a good bit of homework though, make sure to do it!

This teacher is great. Knows how make the math simple and easy to understand. Likes to tell cool stories as well. The test are very straight foward as well. If you did the Hmw you will make over 100s. Also, this teacher is good for people who dont like going to class every day.  very helpful if you have a question as well
his test is not like the homework.Maybe only 2 problems maybe homework examples.
Great Teacher. He uses the homework assignments for extra credit. If you don't pass his class, there's something wrong with you. He teaches very clear, he's willing to help. GREAT PROFESSOR!

I enjoyed Trebits for Precalc and I loved him even more for Calculus. I never bought the book or did a single bit of the book recommended HW. His notes were incredibly clear and he e-mailed previous tests before each test. I went through the practice test based of the notes and made an A on every test.
great and entertaining.

Useless, as others have stated, do not take his class! The laziest professor I have ever had, only assigns the department recomended h.w. and doesnt collect it, and doesn't give quizes. So if you think you can teach yourself calculus and do well on his challenging test, good luck!

RUN FAR AWAY!!!! This guy is useless. Horrible professor! He teaches like you should already know the material and uses examples straight from the book. The only good thing about him is his grading curve and still got a D! DO NOT TAKE HIM!

Class isnt mandatory. His tests are 10 questions so can be considered difficult but if you do the HW and pay attention they shouldnt be hard. HW counts as 10%. He curves a lot on tests!! thats a plus!

His precalc class was extremely boring but incredibly easy. He has this weird grading curve that basically gives those who have mid to high B's in the course A's and those who have mid to high C's in the class B's. Its fairly simple and I skipped a lot but i still came out with an A. Warning though, the tests are really hard and he doesnt help much

He is quite useless when you need help. He only uses examples out of the book and refuses to create his own problems. If you dont like hw don't take him because you will get at least 80 problems a week
